item.title: Positive Semi Definite
item.description:
PSD differential equation Any matrix $A_{d 	imes d}$ is said to be PSD if $x^TAx \geq$ 0 $ orall$ vector $x_{d 	imes 1}$. Examples Identity matrix $I_{d 	imes d}$: $$ A =  egin{bmatrix} 1 & 0 & 0 & 0 
ewline 0 & 1 & 0 & 0 
ewline 0 & 0 & 1 & 0 
ewline 0 & 0 & 0 & 1 \end{bmatrix} $$ Then  egin{align} x^TAx &= \sum_{i = 1}^d \sum_{i = 1}^d A_{i,j}x_ix_j 
ewline &= \sum_{i = 1}^d A_{i,i} x_i^2
ewline &= \sum_{i = 1}^d x_i^2 
ewline &\geq 0 \end{align}

item.title: Matrix
item.description:
Determinant Calculation Determinant of 2x2 matrix $$ A=  egin{bmatrix} a & b 
ewline c & d \end{bmatrix} $$ $|A| = det(A) = ad -bc$ Determinant of 3x3 matrix, also called expansion of the determinant by first row. Link. $$ B=  egin{bmatrix} a & b & c 
ewline d & e & f 
ewline g & h & k \end{bmatrix} $$ $|B| = det(B) = a egin{vmatrix} e & f 
ewline h & k \end{vmatrix} -b egin{vmatrix} d & f 
ewline g & k \end{vmatrix} +c egin{vmatrix} d & e 
ewline g & h \end{vmatrix}$

item.title: Marginal Distribution
item.description: Marginal Distribution: It’s a function that gives the probability based on only subset of the variables.1. For example, Or in mathematical way, for discrete $$Pr(X = x) = \sum_y Pr(X = x, Y = y) = \sum_y Pr(X = x | Y = y) Pr(Y = y)$$ and for continuous $$p_X(x) = \int_y p_{X,Y}(x,y) dy = \int_y p_{X|Y}(x|y)p_Y(y) dy$$ and it can also be written as Expected Vaue $$p_X(x) = \int_y p_{X|Y} (x|y) p_Y(y) dy = \mathbb{E}_Y[p_{X|Y} (x|y)]$$

item.title: Margin of Error
item.description: Z-Score vs T-Score Z-Score Link Z-Score’s formula $$z = \frac{X - \mu}{\sigma}$$ where X = sample mean, $\mu$ = population means, $\sigma$ = population standard deviation. Also, we use Z Score when sample size >= 30 or we know the population’s mean dna SD. Z Table T-Score T-Score T-Score’s formula $$T = \frac{X - \mu}{s/ \sqrt{n}}$$ where X = sample mean, $\mu$ = population mean, s = sample standard deviation, and n = sample size.

item.title: Probability
item.description: Discrete Random Variables A random variable is a number whose value depends upon the outcome of a random experiement. Such as tossing a coin 10 times and let X be the number of Head. A discrete random variable X has finitely countable values $x_i = 1, 2…$ and $p(x_i) = P(X = x_i)$ is called probability mass function. Probability mass functions has following properties: For all i, $p(x_i) > 0$ For any interval $P(X \in B) = \sum_{x_i \in B}p(x_i)$ $\sum_{i}p(x_i) = 1$ There are many types of discrete random variable
